item.title: Litter cleaning, 13th August
item.description:
The litter on the curb isn’t being picked up and the one on the road has been there for weeks, up the street where it is privately cleaned it’s spotless. There needs to be a brush and the parts closest to the curb have the issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London

item.title: Flytipping Millpond Estate, 13th August
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping and waste, 13th August
item.description:
We once again have fly tipping outside and rubbish strewn across the entrance to our flat. Our bin area needs to be contained. When will Hackney council take this seriously? It poses a health and safety risk and encourages pests.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not cleaned, 13th August
item.description:
The cleaning van arrived this morning and didn’t even clean the street probably . Loads of leaves and dirt and litter has been left . He could have easily reached these areas on the street with his vehicle but didn’t do this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Blendon, London

item.title: Corner of entrance filled with dog poo, 13th August
item.description:
For months there’s been a very strong smell of dog poo when walking past this estate, so much so we avoid the route. Recently walk past and noticed a load of grey, rotting poo in the corner of the entrance grass patch which can be seen in the photo.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Upper Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement slabs, 13th August
item.description:
There are a number of uneven pavements in Birchwood Avenue on the street located by the bungalow garage as indicated on the map. These extremely dangerous trip hazards have been like it for the past five years or more. They require urgent immediate attention. There have been a number of incidents where elderly people have tripped, fallen down & badly injured themselves. The latest incident occurred on Monday 11/8/2025. My elderly neighbour, Lyn Conquest, who lives at 1 The Chevenings, DA14 4LA, tripped over one of the uneven pavements & fell down flat out. She has sustained injuries to her left arm, foot & left shoulder. These pavements require immediate attention & realigning to prevent yet another accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Birchwood Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement, 13th August
item.description:
